*HOLA STUDENTS!!!*

If you are going to be looking for a job or internship in the days ahead, then NOW is the time to get your LinkedIn ready for recruiters.

1. Follow the *4 Steps You Must Do* to get your profile ready
2. Start connecting - build your network!
3. Dare Greatly and POST something...tell future employers who you are and what you're looking for.
If any of this puts you in a panic...get on my schedule and let's chat.

:rotating_light: *New Job Opportunity: Data Analyst at HXP (Humanitarian Experience)*
*Deadline to Apply: September 8*

HXP, a mission-driven nonprofit that organizes international service trips for youth, is hiring a *Data Analyst* to support strategic decision-making across the organization. They’re looking for either a part-time student (onsite in SLC) or a recent grad (full-time hybrid).
*Quick Details:*
• *Part-Time:* M/W/F | 8:45–4:45 | Onsite in SLC
• *Full-Time:* M/W/F onsite, T/Th remote (Tues PM = personal development time)
• *Tools:* Google Sheets/Excel (SQL/Python optional)
• *Perks:* Set PTO, unlimited time off, and potential for growth/travel
:bulb: You’ll analyze data from trip logistics to donor experience, helping the organization make data-informed decisions that impact communities around the world.
*If you're mission-driven, data-savvy, and want work that matters—this is a great opportunity.*
:envelope_with_arrow: Reach out to Breanna Pennock (<mailto:breanna@hxp.org|breanna@hxp.org>) with questions or to apply.

The School of Accountancy Alumni Relations team is looking for an Alumni Data Specialist! My friend Jenn Maroney, who is the Alumni Director, specifically is looking for IS students to hire!!

Here are the details:
Alumni Data Specialist
Description:  This person will do the following:
1. Maintain and update alumni records, both on a department and university level using different CRM/database programs. Some coding may be required.
2. Run cross-referencing data reports
3. Assist in managing of alumni user platform and update platform handbook
4. Maintain all the department LinkedIn alumni groups.  
5. Assist the Alumni Director in gathering data for alumni purposes and trips.  
6. Assist the Alumni Director in any other departmental projects/events as needed.
7. Maintain and update data specialist online handbook
Qualifications:
Excellent and proficient knowledge of database management
Excellent and proficient knowledge of Excel
Excellent and proficient knowledge of Google docs
Strong knowledge of LinkedIn
Strong knowledge of Power BI
Ability to be detail-oriented
Able to handle rote and repetitive data entry
Working knowledge of BYU's OneAccord Database (preferred, but not necessary)
Able to work autonomously
Must have regular and consistent attendance at scheduled shift

Please submit a resume and a cover letter to Jennifer Maroney at <mailto:jmaroney@byu.edu|jmaroney@byu.edu>.  In the cover letter, detail your experiences with database management, Excel, and LinkedIn.

The office of First-Year Experience is looking for a new member of their tech team. If you want to start your tech career, this is a great place to start! Plus you would be my co-worker:) DM me through slack if you are interested or email me at <mailto:fyetech@byu.edu|fyetech@byu.edu>. The job description: Web Developer - System Admin
The Office of First-Year Experience is looking for a student to help maintain existing software programs and develop new processes in an ever-changing environment. The successful applicant will be a quick learner with the ability to find answers on their own through office provided and online documentation. This position will be a part of small team that will work together and each member will have their own specialization that will provide unique industry experiences. This position will work primarily in Salesforce, Mendix, and cloud-based communication-as-a-service applications.

Duties and Responsibilities:
• Attend a weekly "Tech Team" meeting to go over project progress and feedback. 
• Communicate with office staff and other student employees to understand the changes that should be made to the software systems. 
• Monitor, interact and maintain the office website's server.  
• Develop solutions for office problems. 
• Implement the solutions using an IDE (Mendix). 
• Communicate with other offices when necessary. 
• Would prefer a candidate who can commit to working through Fall of 2026 
Qualifications:
We are looking for a student who:
• Preference will be given to applicants who can commit to working through Fall of 2026 and work 30-40 hours/week during Spring/Summer of 2026 
• Enjoys computer programming (basic understanding of CSS is a plus) 
• Likes to solve problems 
• Enjoys working in a team environment 
• Can work for 15-20 hours per week with a set schedule 
• Can respond during off-work hours in cases of emergency issues (rare)

:eyes: *In case you didn’t know...*

When you register for an event on Handshake, *employers automatically receive a copy of your latest resume.*

Sooo...
• Upload the newest version of your resume to Handshake
• Update your Handshake profile
• *REGISTER* (don't just show up for the free :cookie::taco: :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:)
WHAT
Yup... so be on your toes! :slightly_smiling_face:
I usually put the name of the company I’m applying to on the version of the resume I submit :joy:

Yeah, I've even seen students that have "Shelley - student name" - because it's the version I helped them with.

When you APPLY, you submit the resume you want. But they get the current one regardless.

*HEALTHCARE CAREER FAIR:*
:date: Date: Thursday, October 2
:clock10: Time: 10:00 AM – 2:00 PM

According to LinkedIn, your prompt should include these *4 key parts*:
:one: *The kind of job you want*
• Job title, function, experience level, employment type (internship, full-time, part-time, etc.)
:two: *Where you want to work*
• Specific companies, industries, or geographic locations (remote, hybrid, onsite)
:three: *What skills you want to use*
• Technical tools, certifications, business strengths, or leadership abilities you want highlighted
:four: *Ways you can filter results*
• Date posted, jobs in your network, etc.

Hey folks! I'm recruiting an intern on my team in watchOS at Apple this summer in Cupertino. It's a fantastic opportunity to get hands-on experience with web development, backend services, and automation.

*To Apply:*
The official way to apply is through <https://www.apple.com/careers/us/work-at-apple/students.html|Apple's career site>. You can find the general Software Engineering Internship posting here: <https://jobs.apple.com/en-us/details/200606145-3810/software-engineering-internships?team=STDNT>
Applying through that link is the best way to ensure your resume gets into the system for all teams to see.

If you decide to apply, feel free to shoot me a DM! I'm happy to answer any questions about my experience, the team's culture, or the type of work we do. I will be reviewing resumes as they come in and will reach out if I think there's a good fit for the role.

*Full Job Description*

The watchOS team is shaping the future of personal health, fitness, and communication. Behind the groundbreaking features our users love is the Tools and Automation team, a group acting as a force multiplier for the entire engineering organization. As an intern on this team, you will help build and improve the elegant tools and critical infrastructure that empower our engineers. You'll work on real projects, from intuitive web interfaces to backend services, and see how your contributions accelerate innovation for millions of Apple Watch users.

In this role, you’ll get hands-on experience designing and building full-stack applications and services that power watchOS development. You'll work across the entire lifecycle, from creating user interfaces to developing backend systems, and learn how automation supports large-scale engineering.

You will collaborate with software engineers and QA to understand their needs and help create tools they love to use. You'll contribute to services that schedule and process thousands of tests daily and gain exposure to the services that automatically build, test, and integrate software. This is a unique opportunity to learn how high-quality software is built at scale.

*Previous Intern Projects Include:*

• Developing a web dashboard to visualize device performance metrics and test results.
• Creating automation to validate software changes before they are shared with other teams.
• Improving our CI/CD services by building a tool to visualize build and test analytics.
*Key Qualifications*

• Exposure to one or more programming languages such as Python, JavaScript, Swift, or Ruby.
• Familiarity with building web applications using modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue).
• Basic understanding of object-oriented programming, data structures, and algorithms.
• Knowledge of web service principles (e.g., HTTP, REST APIs).
• Interest in backend services, API design, and database concepts.
• Curiosity about CI/CD, containerization (like Docker), or cloud platforms is a plus.
• Strong communication skills and a passion for collaboration, automation, and tooling.
*Education & Experience*

Currently enrolled in a program pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
